name: 2-amino-5-chloro-3-fluoropyridine
Reason: 2-amino-5-chloro-3-fluoropyridine has a melting point influenced by functional groups relative to the base melting point of benzene, which is around 5°C. The pyridine ring itself contributes to the melting point due to its rigidity and pi-stacking interactions, estimated at around +20°C. The chlorine atom introduces a strong withdrawing group, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +50°C. The fluorine atom raises the melting point due to increased molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, estimated at around +10°C. The amino group introduces a basic nitrogen, which can participate in hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +5°C.
